name: Wouter Knibbeler
title: Software Engineer (.NET / Blazor)
summary: I build reliable .NET applications with a focus on clear goals, quality, and maintainability.

projects.title: CV Website (Bilingual)
projects.shortDescription: Personal CV/portfolio site built with Blazor WebAssembly with an NL/EN toggle.
projects.problem: I wanted a professional online presence that reflects how I structure maintainable .NET applications and makes it easy to present my experience in both Dutch and English.
projects.solution: I built a Blazor WebAssembly site with a clean separation between UI and core logic. The content is stored in language-specific JSON files and the chosen language is persisted in localStorage.
projects.result: A fast, maintainable portfolio that can easily be extended with more projects, deeper case studies, and deployment to Azure with a custom domain.
projects.tech: Blazor WASM, .NET, JSON content, DI, Azure Static Web Apps

projects.title: CV Generator (Internship Project)
projects.shortDescription: Web app to create a CV and export it to a polished PDF using QuestPDF.
projects.problem: Creating a consistent, professional CV layout manually is time-consuming and error-prone, especially when content changes.
projects.solution: I built a web-based CV generator where users manage CV data and generate a PDF export via QuestPDF. Authentication used OpenID Connect and data was stored in SQL Server.
projects.result: A working end-to-end system that demonstrates full-stack .NET skills: UI, auth, persistence, and document generation.
projects.tech: Blazor, QuestPDF, SQL Server, OpenID Connect

work.description: Responsible for defining and coordinating test strategies and test scenarios for mobile network systems. Worked closely with engineers and stakeholders to align on quality risks, acceptance criteria, and delivery readiness.
Developed a web-based CV system using Blazor. Implemented PDF generation with QuestPDF, authentication via OpenID Connect, and data storage in SQL Server.
